title: 105_s170
content: The "Clone Pager Authorization Act of 1996" amends definitions in the Wire and Electronic Communications Act to include communication made through a clone pager. It also prohibits the use of pen registers, trap and trace devices, or clone pagers without authorization. Chapter 206 is amended accordingly. Chapter 206 of title 18, United States Code is amended to include clone pagers in the regulations regarding pen registers, trap and trace devices, and clone pagers. Chapter 206 of title 18, United States Code is amended to include clone pagers in regulations regarding pen registers, trap and trace devices. Chapter 206 of title 18, United States Code is amended to include clone pagers in regulations regarding pen registers and trap and trace devices. The court shall authorize the use of a pen register, trap and trace device, or a clone pager for criminal investigations upon application and certification by the Government or law enforcement. In amendments to Chapter 206 of title 18, United States Code, clone pagers are included in regulations for pen registers and trap and trace devices. Authorization for the use of a pen register, trap and trace device, or clone pager in criminal investigations requires application and certification by the Government or law enforcement. In amendments to Chapter 206 of title 18, United States Code, clone pagers are included in regulations for pen registers and trap and trace devices. Authorization for the use of a pen register, trap and trace device, or clone pager in criminal investigations requires application and certification by the Government or law enforcement. The amendments involve inserting clone pagers in various sections and subsections, alongside trap and trace devices. In Chapter 206 of title 18, United States Code, amendments include regulations for clone pagers in relation to pen registers and trap and trace devices. A Federal court may order a provider of a paging service to furnish necessary information and assistance for the operation of a clone pager unobtrusively in criminal investigations. In Chapter 206 of title 18, United States Code, amendments include regulations for clone pagers in relation to pen registers and trap and trace devices. The amendments involve updating section 3125 and 3126 to include provisions for clone pagers alongside trap and trace devices. In Chapter 206 of title 18, United States Code, amendments include regulations for clone pagers in relation to pen registers, trap and trace devices. Section 3127 is updated to define a clone pager as a device that receives communications intended for another paging device. The Senate passed the legislation on November 7, 1997.
